name: [the Sequence]
description: [the Sequence] is a logic construction puzzler.Let your mind be your guide: Lay down seven different kinds of modules as your roadblocks to get you (portrayed as a binary data point) to a sweet destination.Apply an out-of-the-box thinking to get you to the next level!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core CPU Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256MB Graphics Card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Simple to learn, complex to understand thoroughly. It's what I love most about puzzle games. No need for over the top art, comples stories (that are waste of development time) or anything that is not related to the puzzles themselves. Pure, simple logic, now that's my kind of game.
Some of these are real head-scratchers. Definitely a worthy puzzle game to blow a couple hours on.

I loved this game so much I bought it on y cell phone too.  The puzzles are great, the sandbox is majorly fun.  Some of the levels are very difficult, but some are a cakewalk. One of the most fun things is to see if you can do them without using all of the pieces.

What I liked:      Simple clean interface   What You Need to Know:      I got this game on IOS, seemed fun but hate touch controlsso got it on Steam     NO KEYBINDINGS FOR ANYTHING!!! need to rotate an object, change the number of sequence, change the state, Must click the stupid icons #FAIL     Keybindings isn't worth not liking a game. What I don't like is there is only one solution to every puzzle :0. NOOO!!!     There is no out of the box thinking, not like others in similar genre.     When I see programming as the genre tag, I expect games like all of Zachtronic's. Maybe I expect too much   My Score:

It's a cool premise for a game, but it quickly becomes tedious. It seems most of my time in each level is spent rearranging the order of operations instead of building cool contraptions. Still, it's worth picking up while on sale.
Seiously, This piece of rotten crab isn't a game.. It is a physics lesson... 0/10
Solid, fun, challenging--look forward to more!
